title: How much do we actually need templating?
description: Is this a problem we invented in our pursuit of taming the cascade with class names?
html:
Update: yes we do

I’m wondering if the “burden of HTML structure” is greatly exaggerated due to practices like BEM.

In my opinion, it’s not so much writing the HTML, it’s wiring up all the classes correctly that makes it burdensome. The class names aren’t there so much to tell you what things are—that’s a nice benefit—but since they are technically necessary to tame the cascade. When the technical need for those class names is removed (i.e. using @scope) is the apparent need for templating still as strong?

Don’t get me wrong, I think templating is great, I’m just wondering if we overplay its need when some of the underlying problems are being solved by other means.
